Class MoveGenerator

java.lang.Object
com.github.bhlangonijr.chesslib.move.MoveGenerator
public class MoveGenerator extends Object
A handy collection of static utility methods for generating moves from a chess position.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static void
    generateBishopMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves)
    Generates all bishop moves for the playing side in the given position, and appends them to the list passed as an argument.
    static void
    generateBishopMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves, long mask)
    Generates all bishop moves for the playing side in the given position, according to a bitboard mask used to specify the allowed target squares on the board.
    static void
    generateCastleMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves)
    Generates all castle moves for the playing side in the given position, and appends them to the list passed as an argument.

  • Method Details

    • generatePawnCaptures

      public static void generatePawnCaptures(Board board, List<Move> moves)
      Generates all pawn captures for the playing side in the given position, and appends them to the list passed as an argument. That implies the list must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the captures are legal according to the standard rules of pawn movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the pawn captures
      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated pawn captures

    • generatePawnMoves

      public static void generatePawnMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves)
      Generates all pawn moves, excluding captures, for the playing side in the given position, and appends them to the list passed as an argument. That implies the list must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the moves are legal according to the standard rules of pawn movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the pawn moves
      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated pawn moves

    • generateKnightMoves

      public static void generateKnightMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves, long mask)
      Generates all knight moves for the playing side in the given position, according to a bitboard mask used to specify the allowed target squares on the board. The generated moves are appended to the list passed as an argument, which must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the moves are legal according to the standard rules of knight movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the knight moves
      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated knight moves
      mask - bitboard mask of allowed targets

    • generateKnightMoves

      public static void generateKnightMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves)
      Generates all knight moves for the playing side in the given position, and appends them to the list passed as an argument. That implies the list must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the moves are legal according to the standard rules of knight movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the knight moves
      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated knight moves
      See Also:
      • generateKnightMoves(Board, List, long)

    • generateBishopMoves

      public static void generateBishopMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves, long mask)
      Generates all bishop moves for the playing side in the given position, according to a bitboard mask used to specify the allowed target squares on the board. The generated moves are appended to the list passed as an argument, which must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the moves are legal according to the standard rules of bishop movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the bishop moves
      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated bishop moves
      mask - bitboard mask of allowed targets

    • generateBishopMoves

      public static void generateBishopMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves)
      Generates all bishop moves for the playing side in the given position, and appends them to the list passed as an argument. That implies the list must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the moves are legal according to the standard rules of bishop movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the bishop moves
      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated bishop moves
      See Also:
      • generateBishopMoves(Board, List, long)

    • generateRookMoves

      public static void generateRookMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves, long mask)
      Generates all rook moves for the playing side in the given position, according to a bitboard mask used to specify the allowed target squares on the board. The generated moves are appended to the list passed as an argument, which must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the moves are legal according to the standard rules of rook movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the rook moves
      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated rook moves
      mask - bitboard mask of allowed targets

    • generateRookMoves

      public static void generateRookMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves)
      Generates all rook moves for the playing side in the given position, and appends them to the list passed as an argument. That implies the list must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the moves are legal according to the standard rules of rook movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:

      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated rook moves
      See Also:

    • generateQueenMoves

      public static void generateQueenMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves, long mask)
      Generates all queen moves for the playing side in the given position, according to a bitboard mask used to specify the allowed target squares on the board. The generated moves are appended to the list passed as an argument, which must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the moves are legal according to the standard rules of queen movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the queen moves
      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated queen moves
      mask - bitboard mask of allowed targets

    • generateQueenMoves

      public static void generateQueenMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves)
      Generates all queen moves for the playing side in the given position, and appends them to the list passed as an argument. That implies the list must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the moves are legal according to the standard rules of queen movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:

      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated queen moves
      See Also:

    • generateKingMoves

      public static void generateKingMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves, long mask)
      Generates all king moves for the playing side in the given position, according to a bitboard mask used to specify the allowed target squares on the board. The generated moves are appended to the list passed as an argument, which must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the moves are legal according to the standard rules of king movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the king moves
      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated king moves
      mask - bitboard mask of allowed targets

    • generateKingMoves

      public static void generateKingMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves)
      Generates all king moves for the playing side in the given position, and appends them to the list passed as an argument. That implies the list must be mutable in order for this method to work.

      All moves have to be considered pseudo-legal: although the moves are legal according to the standard rules of rook movements, the resulting position might not be considered legal after they are played on the board.

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the king moves
      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated king moves
      See Also:

    • generateCastleMoves

      public static void generateCastleMoves(Board board, List<Move> moves)
      Generates all castle moves for the playing side in the given position, and appends them to the list passed as an argument. That implies the list must be mutable in order for this method to work.
      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the castle moves
      moves - a mutable list in which to append the generated castle moves

    • generatePseudoLegalMoves

      public static List<Move> generatePseudoLegalMoves(Board board)
      Returns the list of all possible pseudo-legal moves for the given position.

      A move is considered pseudo-legal when it is legal according to the standard rules of chess piece movements, but the resulting position might not be legal because of other rules (e.g. checks to the king).

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the pseudo-legal moves
      Returns:
      the list of pseudo-legal moves available in the position

    • generatePseudoLegalCaptures

      public static List<Move> generatePseudoLegalCaptures(Board board)
      Returns the list of all possible pseudo-legal captures for the given position.

      A move is considered a pseudo-legal capture when it takes an enemy piece and it is legal according to the standard rules of chess piece movements, but the resulting position might not be legal because of other rules (e.g. checks to the king).

      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the pseudo-legal captures
      Returns:
      the list of pseudo-legal captures available in the position

    • generateLegalMoves

      public static List<Move> generateLegalMoves(Board board) throws MoveGeneratorException
      Returns the list of all possible legal moves for the position according to the standard rules of chess.
      Parameters:
      board - the board from which to generate the legal moves
      Returns:
      the list of legal moves available in the position
      Throws:
      MoveGeneratorException - if it is not possible to generate the moves
